text: Ikeda Teruoki was a Japanese daimyō of the Edo period, who ruled the Akō Domain. His position was given to Asano Naganao in 1645 after Ikeda reportedly went mad, killing his wife and consorts. ==References== *This article is derived from corresponding content on the Japanese Wikipedia. title: Ikeda Teruoki
